alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 28 at 6:18AM HST until January 28 at 9:45AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Molokai in Maui County * Until 945 AM HST. * At 618 AM HST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling over a large portion of the island of Molokai, with rain rates near 2 inches per hour in the heaviest showers. Flash flooding is ongoing, with water over Kamehameha V Highway causing the closure of the road near Kaunakakai. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... the entire island of Molokai. This warning may need to be extended beyond 945 AM HST if flooding persists. This Flash Flood Warning replaces the previously issued Flood Advisory that was in effect for The island of Molokai in Maui County. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
